intro: Lepidium stuckertianum, commonly known as the Stuckert's cress, is a small flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant has small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically lobed and hairy. It thrives in moist, temperate environments and is often found in grasslands or along streambanks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
